paper.title: Attributed graph grammars for graphics

author.org: Lehrstuhl für Programmiersprachen der Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg

paper.venue: International Workshop on Graph-Grammars and Their Application to Computer Science
paper.abstract: This paper presents a formalization of the notion graphic. A graphic is considered to consist of an ordinary graph describing the overall structure and a set of attributes describing the shape, placement, etc. of the nodes and edges of the underlying graph. The formal handling of graphics is done by attributing the rules of graph grammars and by passing the attributes up and down the derivation tree of the graphic.
